abstract: The Federal Trade Commission said it would review a rule after one commissioner wrote a blistering dissent to a settlement with Facebook.
snippet: The Federal Trade Commission said it would review a rule after one commissioner wrote a blistering dissent to a settlement with Facebook.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission finished a settlement with Facebook on Friday over allegations that the company had violated its privacy policy, and in the process said it would re-examine its own practice of allowing companies to settle charges of wrongdoing while denying that they had done anything wrong.

headline.main: Letting Companies Settle While Denying Guilt Reconsidered by F.T.C.
headline.print_headline: Letting Companies Settle While Denying Guilt Reconsidered by F.T.C.
